column4: question. How long does the Ubuntu installation take from CD? If the answer is 40 minutes or so (on an admittedly older laptop) then everything is ok.
no way to know for sure, but if you 256 mb or mor eof memory its very likely less than half an hour

I have 256 meg and its been about 40 minutes with a lot of CD drive access. A new window (titled Install) opened up in the last 5 or 10 minutes but is empty. Just for clarity sake after booting from the Ubuntu CD I should click on the Installl icon right?
ok thanks. I guess its just going to take a while.
looks like there's a problem with either the CD or the memory
can you suggest a course of action? All I can think of is wait or reboot and try again.
describe exactly what happened after you clicked install. just a blank window?
lots of disk access and eventually a blank window. To be honest I can't remember because I was doing other things as well. I just rebooted and will try to reinstall again.
you don't have enough memory to install and do lots of other things at the same time
so try not opening other programs other than the installer
I was doing the other stuff on my other laptop :)
oh. then try to see how much memory it's using
ok will give that a try when able to. Might be a bit because I really didn't have mouse control (slow. etc)
yeah, sounds bad, probably best just reboot
